mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Lund Washington, 1780 April 15
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Correspondence from George Washington to Lund Washington, manager of Mount Vernon during the revolution, regarding a chariot Washington has ordered to be made in Philadelphia at Â£210 specie or paper equivalent. Washington wonders if Lund can get the former from a Mr. Hooe. He also discusses a Bay Mare from Cambridge and wonders if it will not breed, then is it better to sell. Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, with integral address panel. Detail of watermark from transmissive scan.
